title: Welcome and opening remarks on behalf of the organizer

author: Blaž Golob, SMARTIS, informacijski sistemi d.o.o.

segmentation: Before we start with the first session and pulled closer, I would briefly go through the agenda.
The objectives of the seminar.
In order to present and show how we structured the whole debate about you here.
OK, just briefly.
The partners of the centers let me introduce first of all government of the Republic of Slovenia Regional Cooperation Council.
Done European Foundation for Information Society in Academy from Greece.
Siemens Microsoft inserts.
They are the founding members of the center and also the whole event that we structure and the topics that we build upon each child development we developed with the cooperation with our.
Stakeholders.
Briefly, before me we moved to the East Health Area.
Just it is.
Seven pillars model of E governance that was defined by Southeast European countries as the areas of where to develop Information Society in the region of Southeast Europe.
Namely.
Ministered.
You mentioned before the government.
It is the first pillar.
It is our core business.
Nevertheless.
This year we start and we develop also E health pillar and he held was recognized as a strategic area for South European countries Southeast Europe countries.
Briefly.
How we structured develop each pillar first of all around policy environment it means what kind of strategies and policies are needed.
In order that system function, second legal regulation, what kind of laws we need to have for each pillar?
To work and only.
At the third stage it is I city League ICT business solutions if we have good policy strategy.
If we have legal regulation.
At the end, I too will find a solution.
Even.
To go to send us to the moon, no problem, but.
Another thing very important we need to always have in mind this.
Demand and supply side.
There is no use if we have on one side all services available, but on the other side there is no usage of it of them.
From the site of the public.
So that's how we start.
It should.
And how we work and build every pillar?
1st to conduct study background study for each pillar development.
To analyze, analyze what EU is recommending or CD.
What are the legal regulations and at the end with our partners?
And good cases we present what are good solutions and good practice cases.
So that's how we design.
Also this seminar.
And how we structured it 2 days session.
So let me just give a brief information for session.
So what is the context?
Policy, environment and institutional setting for issue.
It was already mentioned by Lady ministered today by human.
How important is to institutional efforts position?
We have second interrupt interoperability.
Very important.
So we're here in the second session.
The question of interoperability as a foundation for the shared services, and then we will directly move to the good practice cases.
We want to learn and we want to see who already did it and how and how much does it cost also.
So those are two sessions on good practice cases will be today and tomorrow.
The possession.
Then we have legal dimension of health also tomorrow session.
Done funding of issues very important.
Where are the resources and what are the good cases of funding and then at the end very important part building partnerships among stakeholders.
If stakeholders are not involved and today we will have very good presentation from the side of the European Commission.
It will be before lunch.
Actually, this speech fits into the first section on context and policies.
But we will have this broadcast from grasses before lunch.
And involvement and partnership between stakeholders.
Again, I would say it is a precondition for every successful implementation of any kind of solutions.
So this is our road map of two days.
And with that we will continue with the first session, but before that I would really like to think.
Mr Scripps and also my paper poker and Microsoft's commitment to bring about giving.
Thanks again and I would like to invite the first session speakers.
